news_header: Five people were arrested in Sweden over the fatal shooting of an Iraqi man involved in Quran burnings.
news_text: Swedish police arrested five individuals in connection with the shooting of Salwan Momika, an Iraqi man known for burning the Quran. Momika was scheduled to attend court for charges related to inciting hatred against ethnic groups. He was shot indoors and later hospitalized. The police confirmed the arrests and stated that they are in the early stages of the investigation. Momika had previously faced charges for desecrating the Quran, which strained Sweden's relations with several Middle Eastern countries. His protests had led to increased security threats in Sweden.
